result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Violation - Physical Abuse of a Child, Repeated Acts Causing Bodily Harm; Causing Mental Harm to Child; Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer; Resisting or Obstructing an Officer; Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc.  Issuing Agency - Monroe PD.
  NO CONTACT WITH:  E.R.B., unless contact is explicitly permitted and supervised by the Green County Human Services Dept.
 NO CONTACT WITH: Monroe Middle School. 
 NO CONTACT WITH: T.W. or K.B.  or their residences, except he may have contact in writing (such as email or text) and may also have phone contact with T.W., which contact shall be non-threatening and respectful and of reasonable duration and frequency.  If he remains in custody he may also have phone contact with T.W. and K.B. via their cellular telephones.    May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.
